summary: The document comprises payroll authorization forms and memoranda from the U.S. House of Representatives, detailing the employment, salary adjustments, and terminations of Belford L. Lawson III by the Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). It underscores the considerations for redacting or postponing certain information, like Social Security numbers, due to privacy concerns, and reflects on the administrative procedures within the House. As part of the JFK Assassination Records Collection, it contributes to the historical investigation into President John F. Kennedy's assassination, balancing public interest with personal privacy.
key_findings: Belford L. Lawson III served in various roles, including Staff Counsel, for the Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA), with documented salary adjustments and terminations.
The document highlights the rationale behind redacting or postponing certain information, especially Social Security numbers, to protect privacy.
It offers a glimpse into the U.S. House of Representatives' administrative and payroll processes, including the certification of staff employees' connections to Members of Congress.
This document is a component of the JFK Assassination Records Collection, emphasizing its significance in the historical inquiry into President John F. Kennedy's assassination.
